nodes.text: Vixus Squadron was an elite TIE/IN interceptor squadron in the Galactic Empire's navy during the Galactic Civil War. They were dispatched to the planet Sullust by Prelate Verge and Captain Tabor Seitaron to thwart the predicted attack from the Rebel Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry. Vixus Squadron sprung from Sullust's moon and ambushed the 61st's starships, shooting down the CR90 corvette Thunderstrike and forcing its escorts to flee.

Operating under the Galactic Empire, Vixus Squadron was an elite unit comprising of TIE/IN interceptors which was considered to have some of the very best TIE fighter pilots. The squadron shared its name with the Vixus, a creature native to the planet Umbara.

Vixus Squadron served the Galactic Empire's navy during the Galactic Civil War. In 3 ABY, the Imperial Prelate Verge had multiple TIE interceptor squadrons positioned near a number of worlds along the Rimma Trade Route inpreparation for a predicted attack by the Rebel Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry, Vixus Squadron being positioned near manufacturing planet Sullust. After the 61st's starships were reported at Sullust, Seiteron, aboard the Imperial II-class Star Destroyer Herald, had the bridge crew open a channel with Vixus Squadron for him. The squadron, already prepared to move, was travelling to Sullust within an hour. When arriving at Sullust, Vixus Squadron hid behind the nearby moon in wait for the 61st's troop carrier, the CR90 corvette Thunderstrike, and its escorts to return for the rebel company.

The Thunderstrike and its escorts—the Braha'tok-class gunship Apailana's Promise and two X-wing starfighters—soon returned to Sullust to retrieve the 61st. The corvette was planned to fly in low towards the planet's surface to deploy dropships for the 61st while the Promise and the X-wings helped fend off local Imperial TIE/ln space superiority starfighters. Once the Thunderstrike entered the atmosphere, Vixus Squadron sprung from behind the moon and intercepted the corvette. The Thunderstrike engaged the TIE interceptors but received damage enough that it crashed onto the surface of Sullust, the Apailana's Promise fleeing with the X-wings.
Vixus Squadron first appeared in Alexander Freed's 2015 novel, Battlefront: Twilight Company.
